Section.Catchline: Fees for filing documents and issuing certificates.

SectionBody.Text: The Department of State shall collect the following fees on documents delivered to the department for filing:

Subsection.Text: Articles of incorporation: $35.
Application for registered name: $87.50.
Application for renewal of registered name: $87.50.
Corporation’s statement of change of registered agent or registered office or both if not included on the annual report: $35.
Designation of and acceptance by registered agent: $35.
Agent’s statement of resignation from active corporation: $87.50.
Agent’s statement of resignation from inactive corporation: $35.
Amendment of articles of incorporation: $35.
Restatement of articles of incorporation with amendment of articles: $35.
Articles of merger for each party thereto: $35.
Articles of dissolution: $35.
Articles of revocation of dissolution: $35.
Application for reinstatement following administrative dissolution: $175.
Application for certificate of authority to transact business in this state by a foreign corporation: $35.
Application for amended certificate of authority: $35.
Application for certificate of withdrawal by a foreign corporation: $35.
Annual report: $61.25.
Articles of correction: $35.
Application for certificate of status: $8.75.
Certified copy of document: $52.50.
Serving as agent for substitute service of process: $87.50.
Certificate of conversion of a limited agricultural association to a domestic corporation: $35.
Any other document required or permitted to be filed by this chapter: $35.

SectionBody.Text: Any citizen support organization that is required by rule of the Department of Environmental Protection to be formed as a nonprofit organization and is under contract with the department is exempt from any fees required for incorporation as a nonprofit organization, and the Secretary of State may not assess any such fees if the citizen support organization is certified by the Department of Environmental Protection to the Secretary of State as being under contract with the Department of Environmental Protection.
